canonical_explanation.text: Shapes are all around us. 2D shapes are flat shapes like triangle (3 sides), rectangle (4 sides, opposite sides equal), square (4 equal sides), and circle (no straight sides). 3D shapes are solid shapes like cube, cuboid, sphere, cylinder, and cone. Perimeter is the total length around a shape. For a rectangle: perimeter = length + breadth + length + breadth. For a square: perimeter = 4 x side. Symmetry means one half of a shape is the mirror image of the other half.
rules: Rectangle: 4 sides, opposite sides equal, 4 corners
Circle: curved, no corners, no straight sides
Perimeter = total distance around a shape
Rectangle perimeter = 2 x (length + breadth); Square perimeter = 4 x side

questions.question_text: How many sides does a triangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A triangle has 3 sides and 3 corners.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 'Tri' means three. A triangle has exactly 3 sides.

questions.question_text: How many sides does a rectangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has 4 sides. Opposite sides are equal in length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle has 4 sides with opposite sides being equal.

questions.question_text: Which shape has all four sides equal?
questions.explanation_correct: A square has all 4 sides equal in length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square is special because all 4 of its sides are the same length.

questions.question_text: How many corners (vertices) does a circle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has 0 corners and 0 straight sides. It is completely curved.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circle is a curved shape with no corners and no straight sides.

questions.question_text: Which shape has no straight sides?
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has no straight sides. It is made of a single curved line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The circle is the only common 2D shape that has no straight sides at all.

questions.question_text: A ball is an example of which 3D shape?
questions.explanation_correct: A ball is shaped like a sphere. It is perfectly round in all directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is a 3D shape that is round like a ball.

questions.question_text: A dice (die) is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A dice is shaped like a cube. All 6 faces are equal squares.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has 6 equal square faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices. A dice is a common example.

questions.question_text: What is the perimeter of a shape?

options.text: The total length around the shape

questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter is the total distance around the outside of a shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perimeter = the total length of all sides added together (the boundary around a shape).

questions.question_text: A square has each side = 5 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter of square = 4 x side = 4 x 5 = 20 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Square perimeter = 4 x side length = 4 x 5 = 20 cm.

questions.question_text: A rectangle has length 8 cm and breadth 3 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 2 x (length + breadth) = 2 x (8 + 3) = 2 x 11 = 22 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rectangle perimeter = 8 + 3 + 8 + 3 = 22 cm. Or: 2 x (8 + 3) = 22 cm.

questions.question_text: A blackboard in a classroom is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A blackboard is flat and has 4 sides with opposite sides equal, making it a rectangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Blackboards are rectangular in shape (4 sides, opposite sides equal).

questions.question_text: A tin can is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A tin can is shaped like a cylinder. It has two circular flat faces and a curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder has two flat circular faces and one curved surface, like a tin can.

questions.question_text: An ice cream cone is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: An ice cream cone is shaped like a cone. It has a circular base and comes to a point at the top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone has a circular base, a curved surface, and a pointed top (apex).

questions.question_text: Which of these shapes has a line of symmetry?

options.text: A shape like the letter A
A shape like the letter J
A shape like the letter P
A shape like the letter F

questions.explanation_correct: The letter A has a vertical line of symmetry. The left and right halves are mirror images.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A has a vertical line of symmetry (left = mirror of right). J, P, and F do not have a line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: A triangle has sides of 4 cm, 5 cm, and 6 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 4 + 5 + 6 = 15 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perimeter = sum of all sides = 4 + 5 + 6 = 15 cm.

questions.question_text: How many corners does a rectangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has 4 corners (vertices).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle has 4 sides and 4 corners.

questions.question_text: How many faces does a cube have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 6 faces. Each face is a square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has 6 square faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices.

questions.question_text: True or False: A square has 4 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A square has 4 lines of symmetry: 2 through the midpoints of opposite sides and 2 through opposite corners.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square has 4 lines of symmetry: vertical, horizontal, and two diagonal.

questions.question_text: A square garden has a side of 10 m. What length of fencing is needed to go all around?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 4 x 10 = 40 m of fencing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Square perimeter = 4 x side = 4 x 10 = 40 m.

questions.question_text: Which 2D shape is the face of a cuboid?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid has rectangular faces. A special cuboid (cube) has square faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The faces of a cuboid are rectangles (or squares if it is a cube).

questions.question_text: A rectangular field has length 12 m and breadth 8 m. What is the perimeter?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 2 x (12 + 8) = 2 x 20 = 40 m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rectangle perimeter = 2 x (length + breadth) = 2 x (12 + 8) = 40 m.

questions.question_text: How many edges does a cuboid have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid has 12 edges, 6 faces, and 8 vertices.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cuboid (including a cube) has 12 edges.

questions.question_text: Which shape has exactly 3 corners?
questions.explanation_correct: A triangle has exactly 3 corners (vertices) and 3 sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Only a triangle has 3 corners. Squares and rectangles have 4, circles have 0.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a circle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has infinite (unlimited) lines of symmetry. Any line through the centre divides it into two equal halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Every diameter of a circle is a line of symmetry, and there are infinitely many diameters.

questions.question_text: A square photo frame has a side of 15 cm. What is the length of ribbon needed to go around it?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 4 x 15 = 60 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Square perimeter = 4 x side = 4 x 15 = 60 cm.

questions.question_text: A box of books is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A box of books is shaped like a cuboid. It has 6 rectangular faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Boxes are cuboid-shaped: 6 faces, all rectangles.

questions.question_text: Which of these is true about every rectangle?
questions.explanation_correct: In every rectangle, opposite sides are equal in length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle always has: 4 sides, 4 corners, and opposite sides equal. Only in a square are all 4 sides equal.

questions.question_text: A rectangular park has length 20 m and breadth 15 m. Aman runs around the park twice. How far does he run?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 2 x (20 + 15) = 70 m. Twice around = 2 x 70 = 140 m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perimeter = 2 x (20 + 15) = 70 m. Running twice around = 2 x 70 = 140 m.

questions.question_text: A line of symmetry divides a shape into:
questions.explanation_correct: A line of symmetry divides a shape into two identical (mirror image) halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line of symmetry creates two equal halves that are mirror images of each other.

questions.question_text: How many vertices (corners) does a sphere have?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere has 0 vertices and 0 edges. It has only 1 curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is completely round with no flat faces, no edges, and no vertices.

questions.question_text: True or False: Every square is also a rectangle.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A square has all the properties of a rectangle (4 sides, opposite sides equal, 4 right angles) plus all sides are equal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square is a special rectangle where all 4 sides are equal. So every square is a rectangle, but not every rectangle is a square.

questions.question_text: A triangle has all three sides equal to 7 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 7 + 7 + 7 = 21 cm (or 3 x 7 = 21 cm).
questions.explanation_incorrect: For a triangle with equal sides: perimeter = 3 x side = 3 x 7 = 21 cm.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has a flat circular base and a pointed top?
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has a flat circular base and tapers to a point (apex) at the top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone has one circular flat face and a curved surface that meets at a point.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a rectangle (that is not a square) have?
questions.explanation_correct: A non-square rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry: one vertical and one horizontal through the centre.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry: one through the midpoints of the longer sides and one through the midpoints of the shorter sides.

questions.question_text: A rectangular card has length 10 cm and breadth 6 cm. A border is drawn around it. What is the length of the border?
questions.explanation_correct: Border length = perimeter = 2 x (10 + 6) = 2 x 16 = 32 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perimeter = 2 x (10 + 6) = 2 x 16 = 32 cm.

questions.question_text: A clock face is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: Most clock faces are circular (shaped like a circle).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Clock faces are typically round, which is a circle shape.

questions.question_text: How many flat faces does a cylinder have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder has 2 flat circular faces (top and bottom) and 1 curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder has 2 flat circular faces and 1 curved surface.

questions.question_text: The perimeter of a square is 36 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 4 x side. So side = 36 / 4 = 9 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If perimeter = 36, then side = 36 / 4 = 9 cm (since a square has 4 equal sides).

questions.question_text: A shape with 4 sides where opposite sides are equal and all corners are right angles is called a ___
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has 4 sides, opposite sides equal, and all 4 corners are right angles (90 degrees).
questions.explanation_incorrect: This describes a rectangle: 4 sides, opposite sides equal, 4 right angles.

questions.question_text: Which letter of the English alphabet has exactly 1 line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter A has exactly 1 vertical line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A has a vertical line of symmetry. S, Z, and N do not have a line of symmetry (they have rotational symmetry instead).

questions.question_text: True or False: A cuboid has 8 vertices.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A cuboid has 8 vertices (corners), 12 edges, and 6 faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cuboid indeed has 8 vertices (corners).

questions.question_text: A rectangular garden has length 7 m and breadth 4 m. How much wire is needed to fence it?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 2 x (7 + 4) = 2 x 11 = 22 m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fencing = perimeter = 2 x (7 + 4) = 22 m.

questions.question_text: How is a square different from a rectangle?

options.text: A square has all 4 sides equal

questions.explanation_correct: A square has all 4 sides equal, while a rectangle has opposite sides equal (but adjacent sides can differ).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both have 4 sides and 4 corners. The difference: a square has all sides equal, a rectangle has only opposite sides equal.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has no edges and no vertices?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere has no edges, no vertices, and no flat faces. It has only 1 curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is perfectly round with 0 edges and 0 vertices. A cone has 1 edge and 1 vertex; a cylinder has 2 edges.

questions.question_text: The perimeter of a rectangle is 30 cm. If the length is 10 cm, what is the breadth?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 2 x (L + B). 30 = 2 x (10 + B). 15 = 10 + B. B = 5 cm.

questions.question_text: Which of these shapes has the most lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has infinite lines of symmetry. A square has 4, a rectangle has 2, and a general triangle may have 0 or 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circle has the most (infinite) lines of symmetry since any diameter is a line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: A traffic sign saying 'YIELD' is shaped like an upside-down:
questions.explanation_correct: A yield sign is shaped like an inverted (upside-down) triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Yield signs are triangular in shape.

questions.question_text: True or False: The perimeter of a rectangle with sides 9 cm and 4 cm is 26 cm.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Perimeter = 2 x (9 + 4) = 2 x 13 = 26 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perimeter = 2 x (9 + 4) = 2 x 13 = 26 cm. Correct.

questions.question_text: A cone has ___ flat face(s).
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has 1 flat circular face (the base) and 1 curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone has 1 flat circular base and 1 curved surface that goes up to the apex.

questions.question_text: A square tile has a side of 20 cm. 4 tiles are placed in a row to form a rectangle. What is the perimeter of the rectangle formed?
questions.explanation_correct: Rectangle length = 4 x 20 = 80 cm. Breadth = 20 cm. Perimeter = 2 x (80 + 20) = 2 x 100 = 200 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 4 tiles in a row: length = 4 x 20 = 80 cm, breadth = 20 cm. Perimeter = 2 x (80 + 20) = 200 cm.
